turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Renewable energy in Italy.
turn.1: What happened in 2005 with regards to renewable energy in Italy?
turn.2: The first Conto Energia resulted in the relatively small amount of 163 MW of new PV power installations, perhaps because solar power was still in its infancy in 2005.
turn.4: The second Conto Energia introduced in 2007 resulted in a massive increase of 6,791 MW of new PV power at an annual cost of €3.27 billion and was the most costly scheme.
turn.6: Almost half of the total cost of the scheme is accounted for by Conto Energia 2.
turn.7: What did the third one do?
turn.8: Conto Energia 3 ran briefly resulting in 1,567 MW of installed power at an annual cost of €0.65 billion.
turn.9: What did the fourth one do?
turn.10: This was succeeded by Conto Energia 4 which resulted in the largest increase in solar capacity so far at 7,600 MW of installed power at the annual cost of €2.47 billion.
turn.12: More solar capacity was added under Conto Energia 4 then took place even under Conto Energia 2 and at a lower cost.
